content.text: 1 Write 3.45 pm using the 24-hour clock.
The diagram shows a square-based pyramid.
Complete this statement.
Convert 3 m into mm.
(a) Work out the total cost, in dollars, of 3 kg of apples and 7 bananas.
Work out the change from \(\$ 20\).
Apples cost \(\$ 1.20\) per kilogram and one banana costs 35 cents.
A student scores 58 out of 80 in a test.
Calculate their percentage score.
[Turn over
Calculate \(57\%\) of 45.
Work out the time the train arrives at station \(B\).
The distance between station \(A\) and station \(B\) is 210 km.
Calculate the average speed of the train in km/h.
A train leaves station \(A\) at 13 44.
The train arrives at station \(B\) after 3 hours and 30 minutes.
The exchange rate is \(\$ 1=0.923\) euros.
Calculate the difference between 750 euros and \(\$ 846\). Give your answer in euros correct to 2 decimal places.
euros</form> [3]
Work out the probability that she does **not** pick a green counter.
The bag contains three colours of counters, green, pink and red.
There are three times as many pink counters as red counters.
Complete the table.
Flo picks one counter from the bag at random, records the colour and replaces it in the bag. She does this 200 times.
Calculate the expected number of times she picks a green counter.
Flo has a bag of counters.
She picks a counter at random from the bag.
The probability that she picks a green counter is 0.52 .
Scale: 1 cm to 6 km
A school, \(S\), is 33 km from \(H\) on a bearing of \(155^{\circ}\).
Mark the position of \(S\) on the scale drawing.
\(A, B\) and \(C\) are points on a circle, centre \(O\), diameter \(A C\).
Complete these statements, giving geometrical reasons.
draws the bars for Biology and Physics on a bar chart.
Tom draws the sector for Chemistry on a pie chart.
Use the information from both diagrams to complete
Kim and Tom ask some students if they prefer Chemistry, Biology or Physics.
Give one advantage of reading results from a bar chart compared to from a pie chart.
11 The scale drawing shows the position of a hospital, \(H\). The scale is 1 centimetre represents 6 kilometres.
These are the first four terms of another sequence.
Make \(T\) the subject of the formula \(W=k T+y\).
Find the \(n\)th term.
Write down the gradient of this line.
Find the coordinates of the point where this line crosses the \(y\)-axis.
The equation of a line is \(y=-5 x+7\).
Sam spends \(\$ 187\) on electricity and gas.
The ratio electricity : gas \(=8:3\) .
Work out how much Sam spends on electricity.
Jai spends \(\$ 180\) on electricity and \(\$ 150\) on gas.
Write down the ratio electricity : gas in its simplest form.
17 Rick invests \(\$ 6000\) for 5 years at a rate of \(9 \%\) per year compound interest.
18 A factory produces brass at a rate of 172 kilograms per hour.
Convert this rate into grams per second.
g/s</form> 2
The rate is increased to 176 kilograms per hour.
Calculate the percentage increase in the rate.
%</form> 2
Write \(0.0000000347\) in standard form.
Work out the area of the triangle.
UCLES 2025</mark>
Kat spends money on electricity and gas in the ratio
Write down an expression, in terms of \(E\) and \(G\), for the fraction she spends on gas.
Calculate the total interest earned during the 5 years.
